meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: Google Earth Discovers Possible Pyramid Complexes

div.div: Two unidentified, possible pyramid complexes have been located with satellite imagery from Google Earth.

div.a: Keanu Reeves Reveals 'Bill & Ted 3' Plot Details

div.div: In a new interview, Keanu Reeves drops some details on the next "Bill & Ted" adventure.

div.a: 'My Sister Paid Progressive Insurance To Defend Her Killer In Court'

div.div: At the trial, the guy who killed my sister was defended by Progressive’s legal team. If you are insured by Progressive, and they owe you money, they will defend your killer in court in order to not pay you your policy.

div.a: Oops, nice one, @Progressive. I always thought there was something wrong with that Flo broad.
Great guy. Awful story. Share! RT @FisherMatt - My Sister Paid @Progressive Insurance To Defend Her Killer In Court

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tz0WY0&via=Digg&text='My Sister Paid Progressive Insurance To Defend Her Killer In Court'

div.a: Mars’ Plate Tectonics Make Life More Likely, Scientist Says

div.div: As it turns out, Mars and Earth may be more similar than previously thought in one momentous way: Mars appears to have plate tectonics —giant pieces of the planet’s crust that move, break apart and smash into each other, forming such features as mountains, canyons and volcanoes — and experiences earthquakes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MWesjE&via=Digg&text=Mars’ Plate Tectonics Make Life More Likely, Scientist Says

div.a: World's Best Places To Get High

div.div: What are the best and worst countries to live in if you're a drug user?

div.a: Is It Too Hot For High School Football?

div.div: Scaling back the intensity of football practice due to hot weather was once laughable, but many states are enacting such rules to prevent heat-related deaths.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MXrlKa&via=Digg&text=Is It Too Hot For High School Football?

div.a: Skirts Hit Great Depression Era Lengths

div.div: The lengths of skirts have historically been an indicator of economic downturn and if what designers are releasing today is anything to go by, the economy is in a dire state. Hemlines have hit their lowest since the 1929 Great Depression, with celebrities such as Victoria Beckham, Katie Holmes and Christina Aguilera sporting skirts far below the knees.
It was two weeks of elite sport, emotion - and data. So how did we deal with it and what did we learn? These are the 12 lessons the data teaches us about London 2012.
Extravagant mansions are popping up along Russia’s Black Sea coast. Activists say one belongs to the president—and that it was built with illicit state funds.

div.a: Skinny-dipping as psychogeography RT @thedailybeast: Nude swimmers find secret Russian palace, & it might be Putin's

div.div: LIVE EVERY WEEK LIKE IT'S SHARK WEEK

div.a: The Humble Beginnings Of Shark Week

div.div: How an idea scribbled on the back of a cocktail napkin turned into the longest-running cable TV programming event in history.
Brent Grulke, creative director of Austin's South By Southwest Music Festival, died Aug. 13 in Austin. He was 52.
HOW MUCH IS THAT KIDNEY IN THE WINDOW?

div.a: How Much Is A Body Worth?

div.div: In America, once a cadaver has been disarticulated into about 60 different tissues, the body parts are processed and made into medical products, which together are worth up to $250,000 on the open market.

div.a: How much is your body worth? @stormt finds out by selling bits of hers
WTF Has NASA Done For Us Here On Earth?

div.div: It's cool that they sent a rover to Mars and all, but what has NASA done to make your life better on a daily basis? A lot more than you think.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OLHbMl&via=Digg&text=WTF Has NASA Done For Us Here On Earth?

div.div: The U.S. Air Force is preparing to test the X-51A Waverider, a scramjet design that should fly at speeds above Mach 6. One day, a plane using such technology could make the trip from London to New York in just one hour.

div.a: Treating Gun Violence As A Social Disease

div.div: Given the recent rash of mass shootings, doctors are beginning to lobby for a science-based, pragmatic approach for curbing gun deaths in a society saturated with guns.
